primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God establishes a New Covenant to overcome the human incapacity for obedience by sovereignly rewriting the human heart.

tekstueel_bewijs: I will make a new covenant
I will put my law within them
I will write it upon their hearts

object.identificatie: The New Covenant / Recreated Human Will
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s will and our will is one and the same
Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord

ontvanger.identificatie: The House of Israel / The Hearers
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of a gift, not the Subject of the action.

tekstueel_bewijs: written in our hearts by the Holy Spirit
In Jesus... the New Covenant is fulfilled
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper who carries the burden.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / The Paralyzed Will / The Law (as accuser)
tekstueel_bewijs: the incapacity of the unaided human being
sin, finding opportunity in the commandment
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power in league with the law that creates a 'shipwreck' and 'paralysis' which no human effort can overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The life of the believer (sanctification) as a result of the New Covenant.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (e.g., the two women cited)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly presented as a 'gift' and a 'result' of the primary program (God's action).

God writes it on our hearts
The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all

we must wrestle with the discrepancy

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'power' (Pouvoir) to fulfill the 'obligation' (Devoir). Grace is defined as God providing the 'power' externally.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S1 (Law/Rebellion) to S2 (Exile/Impasse), rejects ~S2 (Cheap Grace/God 'softening' the law), and resolves in S1 (Grace as internal recreation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God taking the burden of S2 (Christ as scapegoat) to grant S1 (New Heart).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'Babylonian exile' and 'shipwreck' are used to show that judgment is a reality that cannot be bypassed.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly denies human capacity and identifies God as the sole actor in the transformation of the heart.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Call to prayer as a 'part' to play
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: our part is to pray daily that our wills would be conformed to his

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God writes it on our hearts. It happens, because God gives it.
The prisoner can will to get out, but that’s no help. Only the person outside with the key can set him free.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The women cited are not 'models to imitate' but 'exhibits of God's power.'
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: None (Jeremiah and Paul are witnesses, not models)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: the women's actions are 'not their own doing, but a gift from God.'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and security; the burden of performance is shifted to God's promise.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification; God is the author of both justification and the subsequent holy life.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: Soteriology (God's New Covenant) precedes and enables Ethics (the forgiving heart).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Our disobedience becomes his burden to carry... In him all the history of Israel is summed up.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability) that the Law could not.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; sin is an 'overwhelming urge' and 'paralysis' that makes the Law a trap.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of all transformative verbs, leaving the hearer as the grateful recipient of a new nature.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic 'Grace' sermon structure.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in avoiding moralism. By using the 'prisoner' and 'key' metaphor, it shifts the actantial Subject from the hearer to God, ensuring the 'New Covenant' is heard as Gospel rather than new Law.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'beans in ears' anecdote; Greimas shows this anecdote functions to establish the 'Opponent' (Sin) as a psychological and ontological force.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Jeremiah's context; Greimas shows how the sermon maps that context onto the hearer's current 'impasse' (S2).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'two women' are not moral examples but 'actantial evidence' of God's Subject-hood in the world.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (makes, puts, writes, forgives, remembers, gives)
appendices.notities: The sermon adheres strictly to Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'.
